author: @NCRegister
title: 20 Riot Police Sent to Remove 10 Young People Praying Rosary at Abortion Facility in Spain|
text: 20 Riot Police Sent to Remove 10 Young People Praying Rosary at Abortion Facility in Spain On Dec. 28, the feast of the Holy Innocents, the officers also arrested Dr. Jes√∫s Poveda, who was staging a one-man sit-in at the doors of the Dator facility. The Government Delegation (public administration) in Madrid mobilized approximately 20 riot police officers to prevent about 10 young people from praying the rosary in front of the Dator abortion facility. On Dec. 28, the feast of the Holy Innocents, the officers also arrested Dr. Jes√∫s Poveda, who was staging a one-man sit-in at the doors of the Dator facility.The doctor has spent close to 40 years helping mothers at risk of abortion. Poveda was thus faithful to what already constitutes a tradition of the pro-life movement in Spain by carrying out an act of passive resistance on only one day of the year, the feast of the Holy Innocents, while dedicating the remaining 364 to saving babies. In the early hours of Thursday morning, unidentified people affixed posters to the Dator facility [with explicit images](https://twitter.com/JaumeVivesVives/status/1740281778395566476?s=20) of aborted babies with messages such as ‚ÄúHe is a holy innocent‚Äù and ‚ÄúAre you going to look the other way?‚Äù At 9 a.m. sharp, Poveda went to the doors of the abortion center and sat down on the ground in protest near the facility doors. Shortly after, a group of young people from the [Praying Is Not a Crime](https://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/250911/spain-criminalizes-pro-life-witness-near-abortion-clinics) movement arrived at the scene with the intention of meditating on the luminous mysteries of the rosary. Several police officers automatically made them move a hundred meters (about 330 feet) away from the place, where on their knees and displaying a large wooden cross and an image of Our Lady of Guadalupe, they began to pray the rosary. Next to them was a woman carrying a sign with the usual message of the 40 Days for Life initiative: ‚ÄúYou are not alone, we can help you.‚Äù Some of the young people explained to ACI Prensa, CNA‚Äôs Spanish-language news partner, that the officers just told them that there was another event scheduled and notice given to the Government Delegation, and that was why they had to move away from the place. Pro-lifers claimed that, according to the law, they did not constitute a demonstration since there were fewer than 20 people in their group. While this was going on, a group of fewer than 10 feminists came onto the scene with the plan to demonstrate at the site, as they have done regularly for a few years. Around the place they displayed posters with slogans such as ‚Äúkeep your rosaries off our ovaries,‚Äù ‚Äúfeminist struggle = trans struggle,‚Äù and ‚ÄúI too aborted. So what!‚Äù while they used a loudspeaker to play music that could be heard all down the street. At about 9:30 in the morning, the officers told Poveda to leave the place near the doors of the abortion facility, which he refused to do, offering passive resistance. The police then transferred him to a patrol car in which he was taken to the police station. Throughout the hour that the pro-life volunteers were at the scene, the police didn‚Äôt allow them to freely move about and they were followed by several officers. At least one man was told by a police officer [to empty his pockets](https://www.aciprensa.com/videos/dator28d-bolsillos-nc.mp4), although he finally allowed him to continue without further consequences. Another time, when two of the pro-life volunteers came to store material at the pro-life shelter located near the abortion business, several of the feminists made a beeline toward them carrying a banner. The police prevented them from approaching, warning the abortion advocates that [they were seeking ‚Äúconfrontation](https://www.aciprensa.com/videos/dator-28d-policia-feministas-confrontan-nc-231228.mp4)‚Äù with the young pro-life women. This was not the only rosary planned for this day. At 6:30 p.m. several organizations were to gather at the site with the same intention. Also expected to attend was Jos√© Andr√©s Calder√≥n, the young organizer of the public rosaries for the unity of Spain, which has been going on for almost 50 days. - Keywords: [church in spain](https://www.ncregister.com/tag/church-in-spain) [global rosary](https://www.ncregister.com/tag/global-rosary)

author: Lecia Bushak
title: Healthcare brands and influencers‚Äô toast to Dry January
text:
As New Year‚Äôs resolutions take off, a significant chunk of Americans will attempt to either cut down their alcohol intake or stop drinking entirely.
Commonly known as ‚ÄúDry January,‚Äù some people use the first month of the year to participate in a trend of avoiding alcohol consumption and instead embrace sobriety.
Between 15% to 19% of Americans partake in Dry January every year, according to research out of market research firm Morning Consult.
Given its widespread popularity, influencers, content creators and medical experts are taking to social media platforms to talk about Dry January, how they plan to implement it and what health benefits they expect to see.
How Dry January affects the body
Dry January advocates point to some key effects that come with abstaining from benefits, including improved sleep, energy, focus and skin health. Additionally, ‚Äì over time ‚Äì some people experience fewer symptoms of depression and anxiety.
Dr. Jennifer Ashton, a physician and TV personality who‚Äôs perhaps most well-known as ABC News and Good Morning America‚Äôs chief medical correspondent, recently posted on her Instagram about what she dubs ‚ÄúDry Jen-uary.‚Äù
Ashton detailed how she first tried the trend back in 2015 when she realized the longest she had ever gone without alcohol was when she was pregnant.
‚ÄúTo me, it was a curiosity wellness challenge, and I did it ‚Äì I found it very easy, and loved how I felt,‚Äù she noted. ‚ÄúIt makes me feel more mindful.‚Äù
Ashton noted that moderate drinkers may benefit the most, as even just having one margarita at lunch can result in overall malaise.
‚ÄúIf you really pay attention to the effects of alcohol, you feel not great,‚Äù she said.
However, she cautioned against alcoholics or people with alcohol abuse issues from trying it ‚Äì as going cold turkey without medical support can result in life-threatening withdrawal symptoms.
‚ÄúI want to be clear what it‚Äôs not: It‚Äôs not for people who have alcohol dependence or sobriety issues, or alcohol abuse issues,‚Äù Ashton said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not talking about going dry for those reasons.‚Äù
Other influencers, such as psychiatrist Daniel Amen ‚Äì who has 2.5 million followers on
TikTok ‚Äì have discussed the negative impact of alcohol on mental health as a reason to give Dry January a try.
In a video posted at the start of the month, Amen noted that alcohol may provide people with a short-term benefit where you forget your problems only for them to come back. Amen advocated for his audience to give Dry January a shot and to instead work on their issues in therapy.
Healthcare brands go dry
Brands linked to mental health, sobriety and alcohol-free beverages have also hopped on the trend.
Alex George, a mental health advocate and co-founder of men‚Äôs mental fitness app Mettle, shared his personal experience going sober last year ‚Äì which has extended to a full year.
‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt drink a drop of alcohol in 2023 and it changed my life entirely,‚Äù he wrote in the post. ‚ÄúI am SO much more at peace, more confident, happier, productive, fitter, healthier and so much more since I went alcohol free. If you are considering going [alcohol free], whether it‚Äôs for January or the whole of 2024, this is your sign.‚Äù
Other influencers who focus on diet and nutrition are hopping onto the trend by sharing delicious alcohol-free mocktail recipes, to assist people in scratching the itch for a tasty beverage during their sober month.
TikToker Mereana posted one Dry January spicy grapefruit paloma mocktail recipe at the start of the month, which involves lime juice, grapefruit juice, crushed jalapenos and plenty of other tasty but healthy elements.
Go damp instead of dry
Still, for people who may not want to go entirely alcohol free, fear not ‚Äì there are other trends that might fit better with their New Year‚Äôs goals.
One recent TikTok trend, the ‚ÄúOne Week No Booze‚Äù method, involves going sober for one week at a time to cut down on weekly drinks.
Cheekily called ‚ÄúDamp January,‚Äù another trend involves reducing overall alcohol intake to a much healthier amount ‚Äì as opposed to cutting it out entirely. Damp January offers a more balanced approach to people who still like to imbibe every so often, such as during social occasions.
Damp January advocates say it gives them some more leeway to have a couple drinks here and there, especially at inevitable events like birthdays or celebrations.
Damp January also helps people simply ‚Äúreset‚Äù post-holidays, as cutting down overall alcohol intake can make it easier to stick to other New Year‚Äôs resolutions like going to the gym ‚Äì without the overwhelming commitment that Dry January may entail.

author: Javier Jim√©nez
title: No han tardado en aprovechar la fama: as√≠ est√°n usando BlueSky para robarte y colarte malware
text:
No han tardado en aprovechar la fama: as√≠ est√°n usando BlueSky para robarte y colarte malware
Aunque no es una red social nueva, es posible que, como muchos otros, hayas escuchado hablar de BlueSky por primera vez en las √∫ltimas semanas. Ha ganado muchos usuarios que, descontentos con X (antes Twitter), han decidido crear una cuenta y probar esta plataforma. Pero claro, eso tambi√©n lo est√°n aprovechando los piratas inform√°ticos. De hecho, est√°n creando ya campa√±as maliciosas. Vamos a hablarte de en qu√© consiste y qu√© hacer para evitar problemas.
En los √∫ltimos d√≠as, BlueSky ha superado los 20 millones de usuarios y la cifra sigue en aumento. Esto es lo que ha invitado a los piratas inform√°ticos a empezar a lanzar estafas relacionadas con criptomonedas. Adem√°s, saben que es un p√∫blico joven el que acude m√°s a esta plataforma, por lo que ah√≠ tienen m√°s oportunidades con ataque relacionados con las criptodivisas.
Usan BlueSky para atacar
Hay que tener en cuenta que este tipo de estafas ya hace a√±os que han estado muy presentes en plataformas como Facebook o Twitter. Los cibercriminales saben que tienen ah√≠ una mayor probabilidad de √©xito, al encontrarse con muchas posibles v√≠ctimas. Ahora le llega el turno a BlueSky, en cuanto ha empezado a popularizarse.
Pero, ¬øqu√© hacen exactamente los atacantes? Lo que han hecho es algo que se ha vuelto muy popular: generar un v√≠deo a trav√©s de Inteligencia Artificial, donde sale Mark Zuckerberg promocionando determinadas criptomonedas, como MetaCoin y MetaChain, haciendo alusi√≥n a Meta. B√°sicamente, suplantan una marca conocida.
En esas publicaciones, aparecen mensajes donde indican que la v√≠ctima ha ganado una gran cantidad de dinero en Bitcoins. Como es de esperar, van a solicitar que entre en un enlace y descargue alg√∫n archivo o realice algo. Todo esto es una estafa y es esa la estrategia para llegar a la v√≠ctima.
Otro cebo es indicar que van a dar una cantidad de criptomonedas a los usuarios y que no tienen que pagar nada. Van a solicitar datos, que descarguen alg√∫n archivo, etc. Eso es lo que puede contener malware o servir para robar datos personales y contrase√±as. Un ataque Phishing m√°s.
C√≥mo protegerte
Entonces, ¬øqu√© hacer para protegerte si utilizas BlueSky? Realmente, no tienes que hacer nada diferente a lo que har√≠as en otra red social cualquiera. El sentido com√∫n, va a ser un imprescindible. Evita cometer errores, como puede ser hacer clic en anuncios de este tipo donde aparezca que te regalan criptomonedas. Muy probablemente va a ser una estafa e ir√° acompa√±ado de tener que descargar alg√∫n archivo malicioso o dar tus datos.
Tambi√©n es clave tener todo actualizado. En muchos casos, los piratas inform√°ticos tienen √©xito al explotar fallos de seguridad. Si mantienes tus dispositivos protegidos, as√≠ como los programas que utilices, vas a tener mucho ganado en prevenci√≥n. Revisa siempre que tienes todo bien actualizado y tambi√©n descarga el software de sitios leg√≠timos.
Por otra parte, contar con un buen programa de seguridad va a ayudarte a aumentar la protecci√≥n. Instala un buen antivirus, como puede ser Avast, Bitdefender o el propio Microsoft Defender. Es algo que puedes instalar tambi√©n en tu m√≥vil.
En definitiva, cuidado con los anuncios fraudulentos que puedan colar a trav√©s de BlueSky, donde relacionen las criptomonedas. Amenazas como el madware, troyanos o keyloggers, son algunos ejemplos de c√≥mo podr√≠an comprometer tu seguridad.

author: marcelo-gallo
title: ‚Äò‚ÄãSalida de Marcelo Zuleta no es una opci√≥n‚Äô: Marco Pazos responde a presi√≥n de hinchas de El Nacional | Campeonato Nacional | Deportes | El Universo
text: Marco Pazos afronta su primera crisis al mando de El Nacional desde que asumi√≥ la presidencia en abril. Los resultados no acompa√±an y la hinchada se hizo sentir, primero con una sonora silbatina en el estadio Atahualpa luego de la derrota 3-1 contra Macar√°, y este jueves con la protesta de la barra organizada a las afueras del complejo en Tumbaco. ‚ÄúFuera, Zuleta‚Äù, este pedido se escuch√≥ el domingo y se ley√≥ este jueves, 15 de agosto, en la paredes y lienzos colgados a las afueras de El Sauce. [‚ÄòDesesperaci√≥n‚Äô en El Nacional por mal arranque de la segunda etapa de la Liga Pro](https://www.eluniverso.com/deportes/campeonato-ecuatoriano/desesperacion-en-el-nacional-por-mal-arranque-de-la-segunda-etapa-de-la-liga-pro-nota/) Pazos sali√≥ al frente con un respaldo frontal al t√©cnico argentino. ‚ÄúSu salida no es una opci√≥n‚Äù, dijo el directivo en Mundo Deportivo. Publicidad ‚ÄúNo es momento, no podemos experimentar con otros directores t√©cnicos si vienen y pierden cinco partidos seguidos. Sabiendo nuestra econom√≠a, (la salida de Zuleta) no es una opci√≥n en este momento‚Äù, apunt√≥. ‚ÄúLo de pintar las paredes del complejo del club... ¬øC√≥mo van a hacer ese tipo de cosas?, eso no se apoya‚Äù, se√±al√≥ el directivo, quien cuestion√≥ el accionar de las barras organizadas del club, a las que revel√≥ una sanci√≥n por encender bengalas en el estadio. ‚ÄúPero hasta el d√≠a de hoy no pagan la multa, mejor apoyen a los jugadores porque ese tipo de cosas solo los desmotivan‚Äù, dijo. üî¥ COMPLEJO VANDALIZADO üî¥‚Äî Nacional Toda Una Vida EC (@nacionaltuv) El Complejo del CD El Nacional fue vandalizado esta ma√±ana con grafitis en sus exteriores. ‚ùå La Barra Organizada Marea Roja exige la salida del actual DT del equipo de primera, Marcelo Zuleta. [#ElNacional] [#NacionalTuv] [#ElMedioMasRojo] [pic.twitter.com/YHpy8FYdpA] [August 15, 2024] Pazos defendi√≥ tambi√©n la contrataci√≥n de Gabriel Cortez y Mario Pineida, cuestionados por una parte de la hinchada roja por llegar con un par de centenas de minutos jugados en la primera etapa y sin entrar en planes de Barcelona SC para lo que resta del torneo. Publicidad ‚ÄúLlegan como jugadores libres. Cortez es un jugador de primera categor√≠a, un jugador que cobraba m√°s de 20.000 d√≥lares en su otro club, y nosotros no estamos para pagar esas cifras, tenerlo aqu√≠ es un privilegio, tiene tiro libre, tiro de media distancia y es un jugador decisivo, un jugador que te define partidos‚Äù, expres√≥. A Cortez y Pineida se sum√≥ como fichaje el atacante Eli√°n Carabal√≠ (Cumbay√° FC), ‚Äútres refuerzos de categor√≠a A, algunos funcionan, otros no. Fuera un mundo perfecto si traemos cinco refuerzos y los cinco son titulares indiscutibles y unos cracs, da mucha pena porque a los j√≥venes nos toca bajarlos, pero queremos resultados en este momento‚Äù. Publicidad El presente financiero de los criollos es ‚Äúcomplicado‚Äù y con una parte del plantel se mantienen deudas. ‚ÄúHemos tratado de pagar casi todo. A los jugadores que menos cobran se les pag√≥ el 100 % del sueldo, hablo con porcentajes porque as√≠ lo hemos hecho, a otros se les pag√≥ el 33 %‚Äù, se√±al√≥. Declaraciones del Ing.‚Äî Cr√≥nicas Criollas (@CronicasCriolla) [@MarcoPazos2]en entrevista con [@MundoDeporEC]üëáüî¥ "La salida de Marcelo Zuleta no es una opci√≥n, en este momento no podemos experimentar con otros directores t√©cnicos si vienen y pierden 5 partidos seguidos, sabiendo nuestra econom√≠a" [pic.twitter.com/tDNBf2I0BF] [August 15, 2024] Las dos derrotas en el arranque de la etapa desencadenaron el malestar de los hinchas, un presente al que Pazos espera darle un giro con un triunfo este domingo 18 de agosto en el estadio Capwell (18:00) con la visita a Emelec. ‚ÄúTenemos que ir a hacer un buen partido en Guayaquil, no estamos sentados viendo el desarrollo del club, estamos metiendo presi√≥n a todos para que se den los resultados. Me preocupa que la gente hable mal de lo que nosotros hacemos de manera positiva‚Äù, cerr√≥ el dirigente criollo. (D)
